moves.2. d4: he's probably going for d5 to put pressure on my e4 pawn so i press the initiative
moves.3. Nc3: so i triple it (i mean negate once) while developing the knight
moves.3... Ne7: he also develops the knight though f6 might've been better since that keeps the diagonals for the queen and the black bishop open and also puts pressure on white's e pawn (but maybe he has a plan...gotta keep my eyes open and wits about ;)
moves.4. Bc4: i really want the d5 square (after all it's the best square in the whole board...lol)
moves.4... d6: not really sure what he was planning to do (that's always bad of course)...wasn't the d5 push i was expecting
moves.5. Nf3: so i figure maybe he's trying an e5 push and keep my pressure there
moves.5... Ng6:
pretty good move in my opinion...though it's a bit late and he lost tempo

opens up the choked diagonals and attacks e5 (and f4...though i'm sure neither of us wanted that piece of barren land just yet)
moves.6. d5: he didn't take the initiative so i did (sometimes i get a bit impulsive i guess)
moves.6... Be7: doesn't take my bait :( ... of course i didn't really have any big plan at this point except trying to figure out his plan and foiling it
moves.7. dxe6: pawn exchange (yay) ... and then i realized my queen got a little stronger on the attack with the open file
moves.7... Bxe6: develops the bishop and gets some attacking satisfaction in the process...also attacks the c4 bishop which is hanging out by itself
moves.8. Qd3: i guess i thought moving the bishop was harder than moving the queen...or maybe i just thought the white bishop's indirect attack on f7 pawn might come in handy (of course if my opponent doesn't do the exchange)
moves.8... Bxc4:
oops...here's the exchange

perhaps black should have focused on developing his queenside knight b4 starting the attack especially since white's queen was stuck on defense duty (btw queen and rook don't like defense at all...they usually try to bully bishops and knights to do it for them)

personally i've found it useful to let queen and rooks defend lesser pieces and take advantage of opponent's greed for the less powerful pieces (effectively disabling the more powerful ones in many cases)
moves.9. Qxc4: getting back my material...pressure on f7 pawn (yeah right...with the queen alone...lol)
moves.9... O-O:
aha...usually when people castle i start planning...more often than not my plans get foiled by untimely castling (timely for my opponents i guess)

so yeah...he's castled, undeveloped knight and rook...since i'm not castled perhaps i can start the attack on his castle and keep my king safe on the other side of the board...so i go
moves.10. h4: hoping for him to open up the h file for my rook...if not, then the ICBM is on it's way to his castle
moves.10... Nxh4: yay it's open...of course gotta make sure i don't get nuked back
moves.11... Bxh4: protected by the queen he wins 1 point in the exchange...but i get the file and a straight open path to his castle for my rook (if i can exploit it)
moves.13. Bxg5: well that bishop wasn't doing much...for a moment i thought it might be useful to attack the castle...but then again his bishop will be a pain so went ahead with the exchange
moves.14... Nd7: perhaps mobilizing to defend his castle side...or maybe he has a plan on attacking with his queen and knight...rooks are now connected which is always a pain even if they're horizontal at the moment
moves.15. f4: trying to force his queen further away...and now i can castle if i get the chance
moves.15... Qe7: retreating but keeping pressure on the e pawn
moves.16. O-O-O: rooks are connected and d file is under attack (kinda)
moves.16... Nb6: i hate knights...especially the ones i don't control
moves.17. Qd3: at this point i was hoping my opponent has forgotten the open h file and so i indirectly attack the h7 pawn and directly attack the d pawn (which would be the distraction)
moves.17... Qe6: not sure why he made the move...maybe to get the a2 pawn ... now that i think about it i probably would've made the same move to get the pawn if i hadn't seen the incoming doom
moves.18. e5: i open up the queen's way to h7 and attack his d pawn (again the distraction)
moves.18... dxe5: yea looks like he forgot the open h file, distraction works and i win :)
moves.19. Qxh7#:
KABOOM!

ty for reading (if u did)

if not... ty for reading this part
